text.p: These are some of the main stories in Sofia newspapers today. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-- Bulgaria's president Petar Stoyanov is expected today to hand a mandate to the ruling Socialist party (BSP) to form a new government, BSP leader Georgi Parvanov said.

-- Bulgaria's outgoing Energy Minister Roumen Ovcharov is expected to announce today new electricity and coal prices revised in line with inflation and the lev/dollar exchange rate, to go in force from February 1. @
-- Bulgaria's ruling Socialist party (BSP), which has a majority in parliament is expecting the parliament to approve a possible new socialist government, BSP leader Georgi Parvanov said.

-- Bulgaria's Podkrepa trade union will start a protest strike today and Promyana trade union is expected to organise daily protests of pensioners and unemployed in front of the parliament building, Podkrepa senior official said.
-- Bulgaria might face bread riots in the next two months as a result of people's discontent with the policy of the ruling Socialist party, Bulgaria's ex-communist leader Todor Zhivkov said.
-- Sofia students organised a protest carrying suitcases as a warning for a possible new emigration wave if a new socialist government is approved by parliament.
-- Bulgaria's Confederation of Independent Trade Unions said it had proposed to the outgoing cabinet to introduce weekly payment of salaries because of high inflation. @
-- Bulgaria is expected to pay today $135 million coupon on its Brady bonds. -- Sofia Newsroom, (++359-2) 981 8569
